data.title: Here are all the available YouTube TV channels
data.meta_description: There are over 130 channels available on YouTube TV, and that's before including add-ons. Here's the current roster you can watch.
data.text:
Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority

Available since 2017, YouTube TV has quickly become a strong competitor to the likes of Sling TV, FuboTV, and Hulu. There’s plenty to like about YouTube TV: unlimited cloud DVR, three simultaneous video streams, up to six people on one account, and all the channels you have access to when you sign up. There are over 100 available channels, in fact, not including optional add-ons. That’s a very healthy number for those looking to cut the cord but not miss out on your favorite shows and movies.

Whether you’re on the fence or you’ve decided to give the service a try, here are all the available YouTube TV channels. We’ll continually update this list over time.

Note: Not every channel is available in every region. Also, certain local channels are available only in specific regions. Read our guide on streaming local channels to learn more.

YouTube TV

Tap into live TV powered by YouTube. You can choose your own channels and binge without the large cable companies.

What channels does YouTube TV have?

Most customers will end up signing up for the Base Plan, which typically costs $72.99 per month, though there tend to be discounts for the first few months to lure you in.

YouTube Originals

Yes. ESPN, ESPN 2, ESPN U, and ESPNews are all included in the main YouTube TV package, meaning that you don’t have to pay any extra for these channels once you’re subscribed to the basic plan.

YouTube TV Spanish channels

The service now has two Spanish plans. The Spanish Plus plan adds 32 channels to your Base Plan at a cost of $14.99 a month.

YouTube TV Entertainment Plus bundle (Showtime, Starz, Max): $29.99 per month

As comprehensive a package as YouTube TV is, there are obviously a lot of channels it doesn’t have. Perhaps the most prominent omissions amongst the more popular cable channels are Lifetime, History, and A&E. And while it has several FOX channels, it doesn’t have some of the regional sports networks like YES and SNY.
